Articles.Content: The Timewarp Rotate mod was originally created by Skycooler, but was abandoned and recently picked up by MarkusA380, who updated the mod to support the current version of KSP and added a few new features as well. This mod allows your craft to continue rotating during timewarp, this in contrast to the default behaviour where the craft stops any movement it has when timewarp is engaged. zzzÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s video below (used for a bug report in SkycoolerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s version) shows this off nicely! Get the mod [http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/228692-plugin-timewarp-rotate-0-1-3](**here**.
Does this mean I should feel (even more) guilty for killing unwanted rotation with a quick burst of time warp?

> 
> Does this mean I should feel (even more) guilty for killing unwanted rotation with a quick burst of time warp?

Yes, it's cheating. lol

Say 10 Hail Marys and be off with you.

In other news, that video convinced me to buy Hammock's album.
Do things only rotate under warp, or do they rotate out of focus as well?

> 
> Does this mean I should feel (even more) guilty for killing unwanted rotation with a quick burst of time warp?

Hello. My name is Nik and... I kill rotation with timewarp.

![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

We need a support group for people like me.

> 
> Do things only rotate under warp, or do they rotate out of focus as well?

yes, it keeps rotation on all axis' persistently, forever.
This mod is awesome to know about and will try it out. Now for the Stanford Torus!

I would install this mod, but time warp is far too useful for killing time-warp with. 

My name is KarmaLlarma, and...

I'm a timewarpaholic. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

B-but then I'd h-have to make sure to pack enough control authority and have rigid structures! (Great mod, though I'm curious about test cases involving light craft landed on airless bodies at high time-warp.)
guys, look at some of the other video's on that guy's channel, I just checked them out and they're awesome.

So this means I could set a craft tumbling with just a couple of tiny solar panels and that would make sure I never ran out of power due to not facing the sun when I exit timewarp!

EDIT : will this mean that a station about to wobble into pieces will continue to do so or is the overall rotation of the entire vessel kept instead?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-24T11:29:48Z" title="03/24/2015 11:29  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 24, 2015</time> by John FX**
I hope this will be stock in 1.0
Does this also mean my Kerbal pilots can keep turning onto the Maneuver node during timewarp?
I'm friends with Sky, and I hope he receives a lot of credit for all of this.

> 
> In other news, that video convinced me to buy Hammock's album.

 Hammock has been one of my favorite post-rock/ambient bands for about twelve years now. They are amazing.
EDIT: This is not to say "I was into Hammock before they were cool" or whatever, just to express that I agree that Hammock are amazing and that I'm excited that more people are hearing their music and enjoying it!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-25T03:14:18Z" title="03/25/2015 03:14  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 25, 2015</time> by theonegalen**
What is the name of a mod, that makes planet surface look so nice and shiny?

I love this mod, but my only problem with it is that SAS doesn't work during timewarp too. I keep having a tiny, tiny amount of oscillation when I go to timewarp, and then all of a sudden I'm spinning, because timewarp stops that wobble from being corrected. Still, it's a lot of fun to make ships that are actually able to stay spinning, and it brings back the important idea that angular momentum isn't something you can just toss away at will.

Kind of a workaround, but what if you shut off SAS just before entering timewarp? Perhaps you vibration is the PID on SAS oscillating, if you shut it off it might help?

Anyway, I saw this post the other day, but only tried the mod yesterday (briefly). Very nice!
put a little spin on your craft, it will stay pointing the same way (roughly) for a very long time.
